intro: Cenia flosculosa, commonly known as the clustered cenia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are ovate and have a soft, velvety texture. Cenia flosculosa thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sunlight.
